item.title: Providing for further consideration of the bill (H.R. 1) making supplemental appropriations for job preservation and creation, infrastructure investment, energy efficiency and science, assistance to the unemployed, and State and local fiscal stabilization, for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2009, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

item.title: American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 235 - 191 (Roll no. 35). (text: CR H536)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 235 - 191 (Roll no. 35).(text: CR H536)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 244 - 183 (Roll no. 34). (consideration: CR H545)
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H545-546)

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H.Res. 88, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Dreier demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on the question of ordering the previous question until later in the legislative day.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 88.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H535-543)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 5.

All points of order against consideration of the bill except those arising under clause 9 or 10 of rule XXI, are waived. After general debate, the Committee shall rise without motion and no further consideration of the bill shall occur except pursuant to a subsequent order of the House.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 111-6, by Ms. Slaughter.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 111-6, by Ms. Slaughter.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1) making supplemental appropriations for job preservation and creation, infrastructure investment, energy efficiency and science, assistance to the unemployed, and State and local fiscal stabilization, for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2009.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
